woocommerce.step5Desc: Select 'Order created', paste the URL and save

supervisor.noActiveServices: No active services for these orders
supervisor.deliveryAssignedApiError: Assigned to {company} but API send failed: {error}

autoAssignment.title: Auto-Assignment Settings
autoAssignment.description: Configure how orders are automatically assigned to workers
autoAssignment.enabledDescription: Automatically assign new orders to available workers
autoAssignment.leastLoadedDescription: Assigns to the worker with fewest active orders
autoAssignment.priorityDescription: Assigns based on configured priority for each worker
autoAssignment.onlyOnlineWorkersDescription: Only assign to workers who are online
autoAssignment.allowSelfAssignDescription: Workers can take unassigned orders themselves
autoAssignment.globalMaxOrdersDescription: 0 = unlimited. Global limit for all workers
autoAssignment.timeoutDescription: 0 = no timeout. Time after which an untaken assignment expires
autoAssignment.autoAssignConfirmationDescription: Automatically assign new orders for confirmation
autoAssignment.maxCallbackAttemptsDescription: Maximum callback attempts before marking as unreachable
autoAssignment.callbackReminderMinutesDescription: Alert worker X minutes before scheduled callback time
autoAssignment.autoCancelUnreachableDescription: Automatically cancel orders after max callback attempts
autoAssignment.enableQualityCheckDescription: Add a quality verification step between confirmation and follow-up
autoAssignment.autoAssignQualityDescription: Automatically assign confirmed orders for quality check
autoAssignment.qualityPassThresholdDescription: Minimum score required for an order to pass quality check
autoAssignment.returnRejectedToSameDescription: Rejected orders return to the original confirmer for correction
autoAssignment.autoAssignSuiviDescription: Automatically assign confirmed orders for follow-up
autoAssignment.autoAssignSuiviAfterConfirmDescription: Automatically create follow-up assignment after confirmation
autoAssignment.suiviToSameWorkerDescription: Same worker who confirmed the order handles follow-up
autoAssignment.defaultSuiviPriorityDescription: Priority assigned to new follow-up assignments (1=high, 10=low)
autoAssignment.enableWhatsAppDescription: Show WhatsApp button to contact customers

stockSettings.title: Stock Settings
stockSettings.description: Configure how stock is deducted and restored during order operations
stockSettings.onConfirmDescription: Stock is deducted immediately when the order is confirmed by the agent. This is the most common setting for COD businesses.
stockSettings.onDeliveryNoteDescription: Stock is deducted only when the order is added to a delivery note. Useful for businesses that want to track stock closer to actual dispatch.
stockSettings.manualDescription: Stock is never automatically deducted. All stock adjustments must be done manually. Use this if you have external inventory management.
stockSettings.blockOnInsufficientDescription: Prevent order confirmation if there isn't enough stock available. Disable this to allow pre-orders or overbooking.
stockSettings.showWarningDescription: Display a warning when adding items to an order if stock is low or insufficient.
stockSettings.lowStockThresholdDescription: Number of units at which a product is considered low stock. Used for warnings and notifications.
stockSettings.autoDescription: Stock is automatically restored when the order is cancelled/returned. Recommended for most businesses.
stockSettings.askDescription: Prompt the user to confirm whether stock should be restored. Useful for damaged returns.
stockSettings.neverDescription: Stock is never automatically restored. All restorations must be done manually.
stockSettings.allowCancelFromDeliveredDescription: Allow cancelling orders that have already been marked as delivered. Useful for admin corrections.
stockSettings.allowCancelFromReturnedDescription: Allow cancelling orders that have already been marked as returned. Useful for admin corrections.

deliveryProviders.subtitle: Manage your delivery provider connections
deliveryProviders.allConnectedDesc: You are connected to all available delivery providers.
deliveryProviders.disconnectWarning: This action will permanently remove this connection and all its configurations.

deliveryProviders.webhookAvailableAfterConnect: Webhook URL will be available after connecting.
deliveryProviders.hubCityHelp: City from which you ship your orders (for shipping fee calculation)
deliveryProviders.noCitiesConfigured: No cities configured for this provider. Contact administrator.
deliveryProviders.copyDefaultFeesHelp: Copy the provider's default shipping fees to your settings
deliveryProviders.disconnectConfirm: Are you sure you want to disconnect this provider? This will remove all connection settings.

providerCities.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete "{city}"? This action cannot be undone.
providerCities.bulkImportDesc: Import multiple cities at once. Format: city_name,external_id,delivered_fee,refused_fee
providerCities.syncFromApiDesc: Use a connected tenant's credentials to fetch cities from the provider API.
providerCities.noConnectionsForSync: No tenant is connected to this provider. Connect a tenant first to sync cities.
